Interface Model

All Known Implementing Classes:
LoadData
public interface Model
This class is the link between the application itself and the back-end systems that control it.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​Customer> getCustomerList()  
    double getPrice​(Cart cart)
    This method takes a Cart object and returns the total price of all items in that cart.
    java.util.List<Product> getProductList()  
    java.util.List<Product> getProducts()
    This method returns the list of all products in the store.
    Customer getUserInfo​(java.lang.String username)
    Get a user's information.
    boolean login​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password)
    This method determines if a login was successful or not.
    int processOrder​(java.lang.String currentUsername, Cart cart)
    This method processes an user's order.
    boolean setUserInfo​(java.lang.String username, Customer info)
    Updates the users information in the back-end.
    boolean signup​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password, java.lang.String phone, java.lang.String address, java.lang.String cardNumber)
    This method creates an account for the user.

  • Method Details

    • getProducts

      java.util.List<Product> getProducts()
      This method returns the list of all products in the store.
      Returns:
      The list of products in the store.

    • login

      boolean login​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password)
      This method determines if a login was successful or not. The criteria for a successful login is usually: - The username is valid and the user exists - The password is a valid password
      Parameters:
      username - The user ID of the user attempting to login
      password - The supplied password to be tested
      Returns:
      This method returns true if the login was successful, or false if it was not

    • signup

      boolean signup​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password, java.lang.String phone, java.lang.String address, java.lang.String cardNumber)
      This method creates an account for the user. The account creation should be unsuccessful if any of the following are true: - A user with the requested username already exists. - The username is too short. - The password is too short. - The password is too insecure
      Parameters:
      username -
      password -
      Returns:
      This method returns true if the user account was successfully created, and false otherwise.

    • getPrice

      double getPrice​(Cart cart)
      This method takes a Cart object and returns the total price of all items in that cart.
      Parameters:
      cart - The cart to calculate the price of
      Returns:
      The total price of all items in the cart.

    • getUserInfo

      Customer getUserInfo​(java.lang.String username)
      Get a user's information.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the user.
      Returns:
      A Customer object with the user's information.

    • setUserInfo

      boolean setUserInfo​(java.lang.String username, Customer info)
      Updates the users information in the back-end.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the user.
      info - The information to set.
      Returns:
      Returns true if the operation succeeded, false otherwise.

    • processOrder

      int processOrder​(java.lang.String currentUsername, Cart cart)
      This method processes an user's order.
      Parameters:
      currentUsername - The username of the user.
      cart - The cart full of items that the user wishes to buy.
      Returns:
      0 if the order was successful, return 1 if the product is not enough

    • getCustomerList

      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​Customer> getCustomerList()

    • getProductList

      java.util.List<Product> getProductList()
